rules.description: Attacker systematically scanning multiple ports from single source IP
rules.reasoning: Blocks ALL traffic from scanner IP, not individual ports. Prevents hundreds of redundant rules.

rules.description: Slow HTTP attack keeping many connections open with incomplete requests
rules.rule: iptables -A FORWARD -s {src_ip} -p tcp --dport 80 -m connlimit --connlimit-above 20 -j REJECT --reject-with tcp-reset
rules.reasoning: Rate limits concurrent connections to 20. REJECT closes connections gracefully for slow attacks.

rules.description: Slow HTTP POST attack sending data at very slow rate
rules.rule: iptables -A FORWARD -s {src_ip} -p tcp --dport 80 -m connlimit --connlimit-above 15 -j REJECT --reject-with tcp-reset
rules.reasoning: Lower limit (15) for POST attacks. Rate limiting preferred over full block.

rules.description: High-volume HTTP GET flood using multiple user agents
rules.reasoning: Volumetric attack requires immediate full block of HTTP/HTTPS traffic.

rules.description: High-volume HTTP flood targeting application layer
rules.reasoning: Volumetric HTTP flood requires immediate blocking.

rules.description: Distributed DoS using LOIC tool from multiple sources
rules.reasoning: LOIC floods require complete traffic block. Block all protocols immediately.

rules.description: Brute force attack on FTP service
rules.reasoning: Block FTP access from brute force source.

rules.description: Brute force attack on SSH service
rules.reasoning: Block SSH access from brute force source.
Complete block of botnet traffic. Bidirectional blocking needed but enforcer applies per-direction.

rules.description: Cross-Site Scripting attack via web application
rules.reasoning: Block web traffic from XSS attack source.

rules.description: SQL Injection attack via web input
rules.reasoning: Block web access from SQL injection source.

rules.description: Automated brute force on web application login
rules.reasoning: Block web access from brute force source.

rules.description: OpenSSL vulnerability exploitation via TLS heartbeat
rules.reasoning: Block HTTPS from exploit source. Critical vulnerability requires immediate blocking.

rules.description: Generic volumetric Denial of Service attack
rules.reasoning: Full traffic block for unclassified DoS. Catch-all for volumetric attacks.
